Administration.text:
Type: Antispasmodic, urinary
Dosage Forms: 5mg
Routes of Administration: Oral
Common Trade Names: Oxybutynin chloride

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
> 5 years and adolescent
5mg twice daily, maximum 5mg 3 times daily

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation risk
: Not defined, use with caution when administered to a nursing woman

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined
Pediatric: Not defined

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined
Pediatric: Not defined

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined
Pediatric: Not defined

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined
Pediatric: Not defined

Adult: Not defined
Pediatric: Not defined

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Risk of narrow-angle glaucoma
Risk of urinary retention
Risk of gastric retention or severely decreased gastric motility

Common.text:
Dizziness
Drowsiness
Xerostomia (dose-related)
Constipation
Nausea
Headache
Nervousness
Insomnia
Urinary hesitancy
Urinary retention
Urinary tract infection
Blurred vision

Xerostomia (dose-related)

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2-3 h
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: Urine

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
Direct antispasmodic effect on smooth muscle
Inhibit action of acetylcholine on smooth muscle; decreased frequency and urgent
